textTemplates.text:
Hi {!$Record.Business_Name__r.Name},


Since the last time we reached out to you about your {!$Record.Issue_KPI__c}, youve hit the critical threshold. Your business account has reached the last-chance part of the monitoring period.


The purpose of the last-chance period is to give you a final opportunity to adjust your quality performance before {!ETA} (yyyy-mm-dd). This means getting your {!$Record.Issue_KPI__c} below the threshold of {!$Record.Objective_to_reach__c}.


During this last-chance period, your BuyBack capacity will be capped to {!$Record.AlertLimitation__c} BuyBack purchases per day or 30% of your average daily BuyBack purchases made over the last 30 days provided that you are not already subject to another stricter limitation during this period.


We encourage you to work with your Back Market point of contact to monitor your progress over the next month to clarify and correct any issues. For more information about this quality KPI, BuyBack limitations, and tools for monitoring and improving your performance, visit the Seller Support Center or track your performance on the BuyBack insights dashboard in your Back Office.


In the event that your {!$Record.Issue_KPI__c} isnt improved by the deadline, well have to close your account as outlined in articles 12 and 19.2 of the Terms and Conditions.


We value your partnership and hope to resolve this situation to avoid closing your account. Please feel free to reach out to your Back Market point of contact if you have additional questions.


Thank you,

The Back Market team

textTemplates.text:
Hi {!$Record.Business_Name__r.Name},


We want to let you know that your {!$Record.Issue_KPI__c} doesnt meet Back Market quality standards. But were here to help you get back on track!


To help solve your quality issues, your account will enter a monitoring period. Please take this time to focus on improving your quality.


As a reminder, good quality means:

Avoiding BuyBack limitations, so you can scale your business faster

Happier customers and repeat business


To end your monitoring period, your performance must meet Back Markets quality standards by {!ETA} (yyyy-mm-dd) or you must meet the quality standards for 7 consecutive days, whichever comes first. Meeting quality standards here means getting your {!$Record.Issue_KPI__c} below the threshold of {!$Record.Objective_to_reach__c}. For more information about this, see article 12 of Back Markets Terms and Conditions.


In the event that your quality performance is not corrected by {!ETA} (yyyy-mm-dd) or if your {!$Record.Issue_KPI__c} reaches a critical level for customer experience, youll enter a last-chance period and your BuyBack capacity will be automatically limited to 30% of your BuyBack volume.

If you have any questions or would like help creating an action plan to get your quality back on track, please reach out to your Back Market point of contact.


Thank you,

The Back Market team

As provided under article 12.5 of our Sellers Terms and Conditions (T&Cs), you are now entering a probation period. The purpose of this probation period is to enable you to reach the objective of {!$Record.Objective_to_reach__c} stated in the Merchant Support Center article and meet the expected quality standards before {!$Record.ETA__c}. In the event that your quality performance is not corrected before this date, we may close your Seller Account, as explained under Articles 12.5 and 18.2 of the Sellers T&Cs.

Please reach out to your seller success manager for more information on BackCare and how to take advantage of the various services and tools that we offer to help improve your quality and performance on Backmarket.com. 


Sincerely, 

Your Back Market team

Hello {!$Record.Business_Name__r.Name},


Since we last reached out about your entry into a probation period {!$Record.Issue_KPI__c} on {!$Record.Has_begun_on__c}, your performance has continued to decline. 


As a result and as provided under article 12.5 of our Sellers Terms and Conditions, your probation period will continue and your sales account will be limited to {!$Record.AlertLimitation__c} sales per day i.e. approximately 30% of your most recent 30-day average sales as from today (unless subject to a lower restriction).

Sincerely,

Your Back Market team

Hello {!$Record.Business_Name__r.Name},


Since you entered into a Probation period for policy violations on {!hasBegunOn}, your account continues to be in violation. 


As a result of these violations, your daily sales capacity will be limited to {!$Record.AlertLimitation__c} sales per day, or. approximately 30% of your most recent 30-day sales average unless youre subject to other restrictions. For more information about the policy violation process and policy violation tab, visit the Seller Support Center or reach out to your Back Market point of contact. 


Thank you, 

The Back Market team
